bill_title: prohibit the use of MTBE as a gasoline oxygenate.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the use of MTBE as a gasoline oxygenate. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 37-2 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No gasoline that contains methyl tertiary butyl ether or (MTBE) as an oxygenate or in combination with other oxygenates or for any other purpose may be kept, offered or exposed for sale, or sold, at retail in this state. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 37-2-30 be amended to read as follows: 37-2-30. Any gasoline kept, offered or exposed for sale, or sold, at retail containing two percent or more by volume of any oxygenate or combination of oxygenates shall be identified as "with" or "contains" the specific type of oxygenate or combination of oxygenates in the gasoline. For example, the label may read "contains ethanol" or "with MTBE/ETBE ETBE ." This information shall be posted on the upper fifty percent of the dispenser front panel in a position clear and conspicuous from the driver's position in a type at least one inch in height and a width of type of at least one-sixteenth inch stroke. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
